intro: Gueldenstaedtia verna, commonly known as the spring vetchling, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its trifoliate leaves consist of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has slender, hairy stems. Gueldenstaedtia verna is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
